Object-Oriented Analysis and Design (OOAD) concepts
Unified Modelling Language (UML): various diagram types for different system views
User View – Use Case Diagrams with examples
Structural View – Class Diagrams with examples
Behavioral View – Sequence, Collaboration, Activity, and State Chart Diagrams with examples

modules.title: Coding, Testing, and Review Techniques
topics: Programming principles and guidelines
Structured programming and code reusability
Coding standards and documentation guidelines
Self-review and peer review in software development
Testing Overview: objectives, definitions, and classification
Static vs Dynamic Testing, Functional vs Non-functional Testing
Testing Artifacts – Test cases and test suites, stub and driver concepts
Testing methods: White-box testing (Control Flow Graph and Cyclomatic Complexity), Black-box testing (Equivalence Class Partitioning and Boundary Value Analysis)
Testing levels – Unit, Integration, System, User Acceptance, Regression, Performance, Usability, and Non-functional Testing

modules.title: Software Maintenance, Estimation, and Project Management
topics: Software Maintenance: types – corrective, preventive, adaptive, and perfective
Change management and maintenance process
Introduction to Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD)
Software Estimation – overview of size, effort, duration, and cost estimation
Size estimation methods: Lines of Code (LOC) and Function Points (FP)
Effort and duration estimation using productivity measures
Constructive Cost Model (COCOMO): Basic, Intermediate, and Detailed COCOMO models
Project Management – overview of planning, staffing, execution, monitoring, and control
Project scheduling: Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), Gantt Charts, and PERT diagram
Configuration Management – identification, control, status accounting, and audits
Concept of baseline and versioning of configurable items (CIs)
